source.author: Jeanes, J.A.; Jobson, P.C.
source.title: Rosaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A.; Jobson, P.C. (1996). Rosaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Flowers and fruit in a globose head
Flowers and fruit in an interrupted spike, or if in a globose head, then with some additional flowers and fruits on stem below
Flowers and fruit in a globose head with 3 or 4 additional flowers and fruits on stem below
Flowers and fruit in an interrupted spike
Leaflets almost glabrous, hairs mostly confined to midrib and major veins on lower surface; branches and peduncles glabrescent to sparsely pilose
Leaflets densely and evenly appressed pilose on lower surface; branches and peduncles moderately to densely pilose
Spines on fruits unequal in length, 3–6 spines longer than the rest
Spines on fruits more or less equal in length
